text: The flight leaves in four hours.
They could take time to get a taxi.
When we get to London, there could be a line of customs.
Passport check, camera check, traveler's checks check.
What are you saying check to?
Myself, you know, for remembering to pack the thing.
Now you do a good thing, you get a check.
I never realized it was weird.
Hey, my mom used to put her head in the oven.
I asked if she only did it the one time.
My third drawer in my dresser.
You don't want to lose that.
Okay, if you need the vacuum, it's in my closet on the left-hand side.
The garbage bags are next to the refrigerator.
Okay, but Rachel's gonna be here too.
Can I just ask her this stuff?
Okay, because that's not gonna get annoying.
I guess we should get going.
Oh, I want to come over there and give you a hug and wish you luck on your wedding, but I can't get up.
Can you bring me the newspaper?
Hey, Chandler, I want to hug you too.
You might as well bring me my book.
It's on the counter in your apartment.
I can't believe you're not going to be there.
It means so much to me.
Oh, why can't you take a couple of days off?
Fine, you're watching on video when we get back.
Oh, do you need a hug?
You don't have to bring me anything.
I'm gonna be the on-camera guy.
Oh, what the hell is that?
I'm gonna have to go into the map.
Okay, if you see a little version of me in there, kill it.
Okay, listen, listen, we're not gonna have to walk this way the entire time, are we?
Oh man, you made me lose it.
The caterer rang to say it's going to be chicken Kiev instead of chicken Tarragon.
And then the florist phoned to say that there aren't any tulips.
Oh, and then the chair list has cobbled tunnels since then.
We're not going to be... Whoa, whoa, whoa.
Everything's going to be great, OK?
Doesn't that sound delicious at the last minute?
No, but something like salmon would just... it would be so much more elegant than chicken.
And you wouldn't have to worry about the salmonella.
So I can't wait to see where you're getting married.
I still can't believe they're tearing it down.
It really is the most lovely building you'll ever see.
What are we going to do?
Everything's going to be all right.
How is it going to be all right?
I talked to the guy who was shoveling.
They tore it down a few days early.
What do you think of the Abbey camera?
You know they're thinking of changing the name of this place.
Come on, I'm here to take care of you.
So, what do you want for lunch?
I guess we have to eat.
the way I left things with Ross.
I shouldn't lie to him about having to work.
He seems so mad at me.
Yeah, don't be so hard on yourself.
Someone I was still in love with was getting married.
I'm not in love with Ross.
Baby, I'm not going to Ross's wedding because he's my ex-boyfriend, and that would be really uncomfortable.
Not because I'm still in love with him.
I mean, hey, you know, I like Ross as much as the next guy.
You know, clearly I have feelings for him, but feelings don't mean love.
You know, I mean, I still have loving feelings for Ross, you know.
But I have continuing feelings of love, but that doesn't mean that I'm still in love with him, you know?
I mean, I have sexual feelings for him, but I do love him.
We talk about it all the time.
Oh, I can't believe you didn't tell me.
It would be like, you know, telling Monica, hey, you know, you like things clean.
So what do you find gentlemen in the market for?
Well, I'm not going to have to buy that.
All right, look, you're not really going to buy that, are you?
Don't you think you've embarrassed me enough for one day?
How can I answer that when I'm pretending I don't know you?
Then how come no one here anywhere is wearing one?
All right, look, if you insist on wearing that in public, you know, you're going to spend the rest of the afternoon all by yourself.
You're going to make me choose between you and the hat?
I'm not going to be embarrassed anymore.
Hey, I just spoke to your dad and you know what?
He seems to think we'll be able to find a new place for the wedding.
No, but Monica and I were talking and I was so upset about the whole being knocked down and she suggested that we just put the wedding off for a bit.
She said, if I'm not going to be happy getting married somewhere that we can find in a day, well then we should just postpone it.
Emily, do you think Monica realizes how much our parents spent on this wedding?
Do you think my sister's teeny tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here?
I realize that people are going to be disappointed.
But I'm sure they'll come back when we can do it right.
Well, I can't ask people to do that.
Would you ask people to do that?
Don't you point your pants at me.
Anywhere that's half decent will have been booked months ago.
This is our wedding I'm talking about.
The only thing I understand is postponing it is not an option.
This is when we're getting married.
So what are you saying, it's now or never?
What is wrong with these pants?
It's not the pants, it's you who's backwards.
And if you don't understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn't be getting married at all.
So did shopping help you feel any better about Ross?
Manhattan does not have enough stores.
Well, I think I can help you get over him.
I just need you to bring me some photos of Ross and a small piece of chocolate and a glass of tepid water.
Oh, is this one of those things where you prove I'm just open a bed with some graveyard dirt and then hang it from a north-facing tree?
Only if you have the hiccups, too.
Yeah, the pictures are for you, the chocolate and the waters for me.
I just didn't feel like getting up.
Okay, I'm gonna show you a picture of Ross, okay?
And you're going to remember all the bad things about him, all right?
Certainly did that while we were going out.
Before we get started, I just want to say for the record that I love Ross.
I think he's such a great guy.
Okay, now, close your eyes, and imagine that you're with Ross, okay?
And imagine that you're kissing him, and you're running your hands all over his body, and then you run your hands through his hair, but oh, gross, it's some kind of grace, it's gross!
His hair never bothered me that much.
You know, it was always more crunchy than it was greasy.
It's gonna be harder than I thought.
Um, let's try some, um, aversion therapy.
So, um, yeah, look at the picture.
I really shouldn't have said that you were embarrassing me.
I mean, that really wasn't cool.
And if it makes you feel any better, I've had a really lousy day.
I had the best day ever.
Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him you like my hat.
Okay, so, um, what's your friend's name?
Oh, that was... Oh, my God.
Joey says you don't really like his hat, but I think it's kind of dashing.
Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right?
So, I'm in my map, and... Hey.
I understand you had a little talk with Emily.
And was it your idea to postpone the wedding?
Um... I'm gonna go to the bathroom.
Hey, since you're the fix-it lady, here's a pickle.
What do you do when the bride says she doesn't want to have the wedding at all?
I told her it was stupid to put off the wedding just because the hall was gone and she, like, flipped out.
You're even dumber than I am.
Ross, how long have you been planning this wedding?
Emily has probably been planning it since she was five.
Ever since the first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head.
We dreamed about the perfect wedding.
With the perfect four-tiered wedding cake.
With the little people on top.
But the most important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that other stuff was.
And that, that pillowcase thing, I thought you guys were just doing the flying nun.
You gotta help me figure out what to do, okay?
I hope Ross didn't think we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here.
I just saw someone that looks just like you on the subway, and I was gonna go over and say hi, but then I figured he doesn't care.
That just cost me four bucks.
But, uh, listen, I just called to see how the chick and the duck are doing.
They're having a great time with their Aunt Phoebe.
Aunt Rachel hasn't been helpful at all.
But I've just been having way too much fun.
Oh, so you're not homesick yet?
All right, well, the seven of us miss you.
You know, me, Rachel, the birds, the babies.
Yeah, but, you know, we were thinking about you.
You know, we ordered the Joey special.
Wait, wait, where did you get it from?
Monica, why have you brought me here of all places?
I tell you, this wedding is not going to happen.
Okay, but imagine a lot more lights, okay, and, you know, fewer bricks, and flowers, and candles.
And the musicians, they can go over here, okay, and the chairs, they can face this way, and you go.
But if you don't love this, then we'll do it any other place, any other time, really, it's fine.
And I don't know if it starts to rain.
I don't even have a date.
Do you remember where the duck food is?
Yeah, it's in the guy's apartment under the sink.
What do you mean you're going to London?
Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him.
Now, honey, you take care and you don't have those babies till I get back.
But I have to tell him how I feel.
He deserves to have all of the information, and then he can make an informed decision.
You're going because you hope he's gonna say, yeah, I love you too, Rach.
No, because he's in love with the British chippy.
Rachel, if you go, you're just gonna mess with his head and ruin his wedding.
I know this must be really hard.
It's not over until someone says, I do.
